mdRecord.dcterms:title: State Dining Room
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, N. G. (Newton G.)
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Copyright by the Mount Vernon Association
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: N. G. Johnson, only authorized publisher of Mount Vernon views
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of the west wall and northwest corner of the new room. The label on the reverse reads: State Dining Room, or Banquet Hall in which Washington gave his State Dinners, displaying Peal's (Peale's) painting of Washington before Yorktown and the interesting old relic, the Mayflower Chair, with its old-fashioned straight back, which was brought over i the ship Mayflower in 1620. Also, a bust of Washington by the French sculptor Houdon.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (VA : Estate)
George Washington's Mount Vernon
Mansion interior
